The Russian Defence Ministry claims a cluster of about 50 strikes - five for a single village near a military-styled school, one for a military-style school - was carried out on Friday.
The Russian defence ministry said it had confirmed that there were no military targets in the territory of the Ukrainian authorities, and that no reports of civilian casualties had been raised.
It also said that at least seven of the cluster strikes were in response to a "provocative" attack from Ukrainian forces.
A spokesman for the Ukrainian military said that it had sent a number of military advisers to Crimea, and that the militants are "working to carry out a counterattack against the Russian units".

The military spokesperson said, "It's our responsibility to ensure that everyone agrees that this is an attack on our territory - not that it's a military operation, but the fact that it's carried out by a group of armed men from the Ukrainian and Russian armed forces."
The Ukrainian army said that it did not have any military personnel involved in the attack.
The military's spokesman said: "This is an attack on our territory, not on the Ukrainian army, but rather on the Russian forces. We are doing all we can to prevent this from happening."

A Ukrainian official, speaking on condition of anonymity, said that the strike was a "clear violation" of international law as the Ukrainian military "does not have any military presence in the territory of the Russian Federation".
Russian foreign ministry spokesman Dmitry Peskov said on Thursday that the strike was "an attack on a military asset".
The Russian defence ministry said: "This [the strike] is a clear violation of international law and international humanitarian law."
The military said it had no troops involved in the attack.
